timeline.bodyText: What is the reason for moving away from NamedPreparedStatement here?
timeline.author: ivantha

replies.bodyText:
NamedPreparedstatement having issue with postgresql. With postgresql if we use namedpreparedstatment it is always expecting the returned key and throwing [1]. Thatswhy changed to Preparedstatement
[1] wso2/product-is#9608
replies.author: nilasini

timeline.author: ivantha

timeline.bodyText: Since we are using a UUID and the db scema reflects the property as a UUID, isn't it better to keep the initial naming in order to have more consistency? WDYT?
timeline.author: ivantha

replies.bodyText: If we using UUID as the name then while importing it is conflicting with java.utils.UUID that's why changed the name so that static imports will work for java UUID as well.
replies.author: nilasini

timeline.bodyText: Does this work for the NamedPreparedStatement without the initial RETURN_GENERATED_KEYS parameter?
timeline.author: ivantha

replies.bodyText:
Yes because NamedPreparedStatement already handled the expected returning columns through [1]
[1] https://github.com/wso2/carbon-utils/blob/master/components/org.wso2.carbon.database.utils/src/main/java/org/wso2/carbon/database/utils/jdbc/NamedPreparedStatement.java#L86
replies.author: nilasini
